Feel free to reach out to me if you are interested in career opportunities with AWS or visit our career page at http://aws.amazon.com/careers/ Client Recruitment Specialist American Express / Allegis Group Services June 2011  –  June 2012  (1 year 1 month) Phoenix AZ Allegis Group Services is a recruitment outsourcing company that specialized in complete recruitment process outsourcing. The RPO (recruitment process outsourcing) with American Express began in January of 2011. It is to date the largest RPO of its kind in the world and to date we have filled over 12,000 positions globally.  
 
As a corporate recruiter for American Express Technologies (AET) I am responsible for the full lifecyle of recruiting including requisition qualification, sourcing, resume and phone screening, delivery and hiring for openings within the AET organization. On average I am responsible for 30 to 60 positions that are in various stages of the recruiting lifecyle and I filled 195 individual requirements and hired over 200 individuals in my time with the American Express Account. 
 
Day to day responsibilities include: 
Defining new position requirements and working with hiring leaders to understand their needs. 
Building sourcing strategies and posting strategies for each position in order to gain the best candidate. This is done by utilizing both internal and external sources such as LinkedIn, Monster, Dice, various user groups, and other sources. 
Screening through all applicants for each position (up to 350+ applicants per position) and identifying the most qualified to shortlist and interview for each position.  
Interview each shortlisted candidate to further screen and present top candidates to the hiring leader. 
Gain feedback from hiring leaders on shortlisted candidates and identify candidates to be  
Schedule interviews for candidates with hiring leaders and confirm the day before that they are ready for their interview. 
Mentor and train fellow team members on recruiting best practices to get them ready for promotion. 
Aided in the creation of the operations manual for the account and continues to identify ways of improving the recruiting process. 
Hit 100% of our SLA’s for our groups. Recruiter TEKsystems December 2009  –  June 2011  (1 year 7 months) TEKsystems is an IT Services Provider with an office in  
Phoenix and ninety offices throughout the US, Canada and Europe. We specialize in a wide variety of IT Services including: turn-key Infrastructure Deployments, IT Asset Disposal, Asset Inventories, IT Training, QA Testing, Applications Development (On-Shore/Off-Shore and Near Shore), IT Staffing, etc Senior Account Specialist Enterprise Commercial Trucks Division July 2008  –  December 2009  (1 year 6 months) The commercial truck division is a newer part of the enterprise business and unlike car rental still very small compared to competitors like Penske or Ryder. This meant that we had to work very hard for every customer and make sure we not only provided a competitive price but service that went above and beyond the competition. As a senior account specialist I was responsible for the entire lifecycle of renting a vehicle starting with identifying the customer and ending with the successful rental and return of the vehicle.  
Identified, marketed, and landed over 40 new accounts to date. 
Negotiated daily rates, mileage fees, and insurance with all new customers. 
Reviewed existing customers' rate plans and negotiated new terms yearly or as their needs changes. 
Negotiated longer term or lease rental agreements with both new and existing customers. 
Provided service to over 80 accounts spread throughout the Phoenix area which included cleaning and inspecting vehicles to validate they meet DOT regulations, delivering vehicles to the client site and finally picking up, checking in vehicles and collecting payment once the customer is done.  
Provide break down assistance and dispatch of vendors if outside our range. 
Scheduling regular maintenance for all vehicles to minimize breakdowns and potential safety issues or violations. 
Maintain a 95% satisfaction rating for all customers.  
Used Microsoft CRM to track all clients information. Senior Account Specialist Enterprise Rent a Car May 2007  –  December 2009  (2 years 8 months) Getting the consultant through our quality process with includes checking references, interviewing them, and in some cases administering a technical assessment. 
Coordinating interviews and in many cases meeting the consultant on site for an in person interview to answer last minute question or to assist them in case they get lost. 
Scheduling new hire paperwork for consultants once they have been offered a position. 
Maintaining constant communication with all consultants that are on a client's site which includes meeting them for lunch at least once a month in order to see how the project is going.  
Provide feedback to the consultant on the work they are doing and any changes on that may affect the consultant. 
Proactively begin looking for other opportunities for consultant at least 30 days before the end of their contract in the effort to keep them continuously employed.  
Identify leads with new businesses that could benefit from any of our services offerings. 
Set up meetings with hiring managers to understand their current and future needs and the challenges they are facing.; Enterprise in the largest car rental company in the world with over 1 million vehicles in their fleet and in the Phoenix area alone there is over 100 offices servicing everything from dealerships and body shops to upscale resorts and beyond. Management Trainee Enterprise Rent a Car May 2007  –  June 2008  (1 year 2 months) As a management trainee I was responsible for assisting customers with the car reservation, rental and return.  
During this time the branch I worked at serviced over 10 dealerships, 7 body shops and numerous corporate and retail customers. I would pick up customers and drive to the branch where I would type up the rental contract, secure a deposit, inspect the car and sell the insurance products to the customer. Upon return I would check the car for damage and report any filing a claim with the customer insurance and collect payment.  
Appointed the branch marketing manager. 
Marketed existing corporate clients and new clients. 
Handled all customer needs from taking reservations to checking in returned cars.
